Class TicTacToe

  • java.lang.Object
    • TicTacToe

  • public class TicTacToe
extends java.lang.Object
    begins a tic-tac-toe game with COMPUTER player X/player 1 begins first the gameboard will be printed in the beginning, ending, and every turn's end
    Author:
    Dikai Fang

        row - the row index
        col - the column index

      • playerWins

        public static boolean playerWins(char[][] board,
                                 int player)
        check if the player has three of its markers in a line by vertical, horizontal and diagonal
        Parameters:
        board - gameboard
        player - int representing player
        Returns:
        true if there is a line of three markers in vertical, horizontal or diagonal direction

        Returns:

      • depth

        public static int depth(char[][] gameboard)
        calculate the gameboard's empty slots
        Parameters:
        gameboard - char[3][3]
        Returns:

      • freeSlots

        public static java.util.ArrayList<int[]> freeSlots(char[][] gameboard)
        find all available space on gameboard
        Parameters:
        gameboard - char[][], the gameboard
        Returns:
        ArrayList of int[], each int[] represents a free space {row, col}

      • heuristic

        public static int heuristic(char[][] gameboard,
                            int player,
                            int[] move,
                            int depth)
        evaluate the move the player played on gameboard
        Parameters:
        gameboard - char[][], the game board
        player - int, represent the player or COMPUTER by 0 or 1
        move - int[], {row, col}
        depth - int, the depth of the tree
        Returns:
        int, heuristic value for the move

      • miniMax

        public static int[] miniMax(char[][] gameboard,
                            int depth,
                            int[] move,
                            int player)
        minimax search, use backtracking to evaluate every possible next move, if the next move's heuristic value is bigger, take it as next-move-to-be
        Parameters:
        gameboard - char[][] gameboard
        depth - int, the depth of the tree
        move - int[], the move the player going to play
        player - int, representing the player or COMPUTER by 0 or 1
        Returns:
        int[], the bestMove can make for player, {row, col}
